pageContext.claim: “Somebody said, In the great state of Texas, Donald Trump is down two points to Buttigieg, Buttigieg, Buttigieg. They're phony polls. You know they have phony polls. I told the story the other night.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump calls polls phony when he dislikes the result. But this was a real poll, conducted by a respected pollster. The Quinnipiac University poll released in June showed that Joe Biden would top Trump by four points — 48 percent to 44 percent — in a general election matchup there. The next strongest candidate in the state was Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, who the poll found losing to the president by only 1 point, 46 percent to 45 percent. Next was South Bend Mayor Pete Buttigieg, whose then-rising star landed him within 2 points of Trump in a head-to-head matchup. The result in the deep red state may be surprising but Quinnipiac earns a B+ rating from the poling gurus at FiveThirtyEight.
